intro: Pimpinella ionantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowparsnip, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white flowers are arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels, which are characteristic of the family. The plant is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
